title: Mobile navigation improvements and Finance Trends Net Balance only

requirements.summary: Remove the Finance Trends Compare mode and always render the existing Net Balance line chart with identical behavior/appearance to the prior Net Balance mode.
acceptanceCriteria: The Finance Trends card no longer shows a Compare toggle/button anywhere in the UI.
The Finance Trends chart always displays the Net Balance series only.
Net Balance values and formatting match the previous Net Balance mode exactly for both 7-day and 30-day ranges.

file_operations.description: Update the FinanceTrends card to remove the Compare UI/control and any compare-only rendering; render only the existing Net Balance line chart configuration (same chartData inputs/calculation, same line styling, axes, tooltip formatter, legend behavior, and layout as the prior Net Balance mode).

requirements.summary: Add mobile-only navigation controls to switch between Dashboard and Daily View on phone-sized screens without affecting desktop/tablet navigation layout.
acceptanceCriteria: On phone-sized screens, there are clearly labeled, tappable controls to switch to Dashboard and to Daily View.
Switching views works without requiring desktop/tablet breakpoints.

file_operations.description: Add a phone-only (e.g., md:hidden) navigation control group in the header that exposes Dashboard and Daily View switches using the existing onViewChange behavior; ensure the controls are visible and tappable on small screens while leaving the existing md+ navigation unchanged.

requirements.summary: On phone-sized screens only, shorten Daily View tab labels to single-letter abbreviations without changing tab values or behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On phone-sized screens, the Daily View TabsTrigger labels display as O/A/F/H/J.
On tablet and desktop screens, the Daily View tab labels display as Overview/Activities/Finance/Habits/Journal.
Only the label text changes; tab values/selection behavior remain identical.

file_operations.description: Adjust each TabsTrigger label to render a mobile-only single-letter abbreviation (O/A/F/H/J) and a tablet/desktop full label using responsive utility classes (e.g., show abbreviation below the sm breakpoint and full text at sm+), keeping all TabsTrigger values and selection behavior unchanged.

requirements.summary: Ensure changes remain strictly scoped to the requested UI adjustments and do not alter backend logic, saved data, or desktop/tablet layout beyond the specified items.
acceptanceCriteria: No backend (Motoko) code changes are required for this build.
Desktop/tablet UI behavior remains the same except that Finance Trends no longer offers Compare (and only shows Net Balance).
No data model, storage, or calculation changes occur outside the already-existing Net Balance calculation.

file_operations.description: Confirm the Finance Trends changes are limited to removing Compare and defaulting to the existing Net Balance rendering only; avoid touching other dashboard finance cards/charts and preserve all existing Net Balance calculations/formatting.

Implement mobile-only navigation with responsive classes so that desktop/tablet header layout and behavior remain unchanged, while phone users always have an obvious way to switch between Dashboard and Daily View.
Implement mobile-only tab label abbreviation purely as a responsive text change, ensuring tablet/desktop labels and all tab behavior remain unchanged.
